title.narrative: U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) Foundation: Conditional Gifts and Donations

description.narrative: U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) Foundation gifts and donations are considered conditional if the donor restricts its purpose or imposes a requirement that the gift be used: (1) To support a specific research study, project, or conference; (2) To support activities of a CDC employee identified by name or organizational title; (3) For specifically identified functions, such as observances, ceremonies, particular public information or health promotion campaigns, and community outreach activities; (4) For the purchase of specific items of equipment or other specific uses.

title.narrative: U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention: Ebola Response and Preparedness

description.narrative: International Ebola Response and Preparedness. U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC), Division of Global Health Protection (DGHP) leads CDCs efforts to help partner countries meet the goals of the Global Health Security Agenda. The Global Health Security Agenda aims to close gaps in preparedness and accelerate progress toward a world safe and secure from infectious disease threats. This work is critical to protecting health around the world and is focused on: (1) Disease surveillance and outbreak response, including establishing routine surveillance for priority diseases and developing information technology tools and systems; (2) Emergency management, ensuring countries have the knowledge and resources they need, including emergency operations centers that can mount a fast, coordinated response when outbreaks happen; (3) Safe laboratory systems and diagnostics, building the capacity to identify disease threats close to the source and inform decision-making; (4) Developing the workforce, training frontline responders, laboratorians, disease detectives, emergency managers, and other health professionals who are responsible for taking the lead when crisis strikes.

title.narrative: Global AIDS: Systems Strengthening of Tanzanian Ministry of Health and Social Welfare under PEPFAR

description.narrative: The U.S. President's Emergency Plan for AIDS Relief (PEPFAR) is the U.S. Government initiative to help save the lives of those suffering from HIV/AIDS around the world. This historic commitment is the largest by any nation to combat a single disease internationally, and PEPFAR investments also help alleviate suffering from other diseases across the global health spectrum. PEPFAR is the cornerstone and largest component of the U.S. President's Global Health Initiative. With a special focus on improving the health of women, newborns and children, the Global Health Initiative's goal is to save the greatest number of lives by increasing and building upon what works and, then, supporting countries as they work to improve the health of their own people.

title.narrative: Global AIDS: Strengthening the Quality, Accessibility, and Sustainability of the National Health Laboratory Services (NHLS) in Tanzania under PEPFAR

description.narrative: The U.S. President's Emergency Plan for AIDS Relief (PEPFAR) is the U.S. Government initiative to help save the lives of those suffering from HIV/AIDS around the world. This historic commitment is the largest by any nation to combat a single disease internationally, and PEPFAR investments also help alleviate suffering from other diseases across the global health spectrum. PEPFAR is the cornerstone and largest component of the U.S. President's Global Health Initiative. With a special focus on improving the health of women, newborns and children, the Global Health Initiative's goal is to save the greatest number of lives by increasing and building upon what works and, then, supporting countries as they work to improve the health of their own people.

title.narrative: Global AIDS: Building Capacity within the Government of Tanzania to Oversee Laboratory, Strengthen Scientific Oversight, Monitor Evidence-based HIV Interventions, and Conduct Geo-spatial Analysis under the President's Emergency Plan for AIDS Relief (PEPFAR)

description.narrative: The U.S. President's Emergency Plan for AIDS Relief (PEPFAR) is the U.S. Government initiative to help save the lives of those suffering from HIV/AIDS around the world. This historic commitment is the largest by any nation to combat a single disease internationally, and PEPFAR investments also help alleviate suffering from other diseases across the global health spectrum. PEPFAR is the cornerstone and largest component of the U.S. President's Global Health Initiative. With a special focus on improving the health of women, newborns and children, the Global Health Initiative's goal is to save the greatest number of lives by increasing and building upon what works and, then, supporting countries as they work to improve the health of their own people.

title.narrative: Global AIDS: Sustain and Accelerate a Comprehensive HIV Response in Tanzania under PEPFAR

description.narrative: The U.S. President's Emergency Plan for AIDS Relief (PEPFAR) is the U.S. Government initiative to help save the lives of those suffering from HIV/AIDS around the world. This historic commitment is the largest by any nation to combat a single disease internationally, and PEPFAR investments also help alleviate suffering from other diseases across the global health spectrum. PEPFAR is the cornerstone and largest component of the U.S. President's Global Health Initiative. With a special focus on improving the health of women, newborns and children, the Global Health Initiative's goal is to save the greatest number of lives by increasing and building upon what works and, then, supporting countries as they work to improve the health of their own people.

description.narrative: U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) Investigations and Technical Assistance assists national and local health authorities and other health related organizations in controlling communicable diseases, chronic diseases and disorders, and other preventable health conditions. Investigations and evaluation of all methods of controlling or preventing disease and disability are carried out by providing epidemic aid, surveillance, technical assistance, consultation, and program support; and by providing leadership and coordination of joint national, state, and local efforts.

description.narrative: U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) Investigations and Technical Assistance assists national and local health authorities and other health related organizations in controlling communicable diseases, chronic diseases and disorders, and other preventable health conditions. Investigations and evaluation of all methods of controlling or preventing disease and disability are carried out by providing epidemic aid, surveillance, technical assistance, consultation, and program support; and by providing leadership and coordination of joint national, state, and local efforts.
